PiLR: A platform for mobile health researchers
Period: A defined interval for participants, possibly overlapping with other periods.
Epoch: A defined interval of time *within periods* for participants, not overlapping with other epochs in the same period
Participant: An individual enrolled in a study who data is able to upload data from instruments into PiLR
Instrument: Software or hardware device configured to upload data to PiLR
mHealth: Abbreviation for 'mobile health', the type of data PiLR is designed to collect
Project: A name for a study with participants, instruments, and settings
API: Abbreviation for 'application programming interface', allows PiLR to interact with instruments and dashboards
Dashboard: Set of panels displaying charts that summarize participant data for a project
Analysis Tool: Web apps designed to allow you to interact and explore your project data
Dataset: Instruments write to one or more datasets, which can be merged with each other
Template: A set of configuration rules for participants in the project, that defines what instruments are enabled during specific periods
Category: Grouping of participants by a category, such as gender or treatment
Group: Specific group within a category. If 'gender' is the category, ' male' and 'female' are the groups
Project Team: Assign roles to PiLR users for a project
Participant Data: Data generated by an instrument for a particular participant
EMA: Smartphone app to deliver versatile mobile surveys to participants
Setting: Cause instruments to behave differently depending on value
Schedule: Concrete realization of a template declaring exactly when certain events happen for a given group category or participant
